intro: Dicheranthus plocamoides, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Dicheranthus plocamoides is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
